alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 3:30PM CDT until May 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: .Flood waters are beginning to recede; however, numerous low water crossings remain underwater and impassable. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in northwest Kansas, Decatur and Rawlins. In southwest Nebraska, Hitchcock and Red Willow. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McCook, Trenton, Culbertson, Herndon and Traer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
